metadata.title: CVE-2014-1492 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The cert_TestHostName function in lib/certdb/certdb.c in thecertificate-checking implementation in Mozilla Network Security Services(NSS) before 3.16 accepts a wildcard character that is embedded in aninternationalized domain name's U-label, which might allowman-in-the-middle attackers to spoof SSL servers via a crafted certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1492` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7
libnss3-1d - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7
libnss3-tools - 2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '29.0+build1-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
nss package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.15.4-1ubuntu7').
